trans-unit.source: If you don't see your problem addressed here or have questions, post them on the <link><linkText>forum</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't see your problem addressed here or have questions, post them on the <link><linkText>forum</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Windows Container Image must exactly match container host
trans-unit.target: Windows Container Image must exactly match container host

trans-unit.source: A Windows Server Container requires an operating system image that matches the container host in respect to build and patch level.
trans-unit.target: A Windows Server Container requires an operating system image that matches the container host in respect to build and patch level.

trans-unit.source: A mismatch will lead to instability and or unpredictable behavior for the container and/or the host.
trans-unit.target: A mismatch will lead to instability and or unpredictable behavior for the container and/or the host.

trans-unit.source: If you install updates against the Windows container host OS you will need to update the container base OS image to have the matching updates.
trans-unit.target: If you install updates against the Windows container host OS you will need to update the container base OS image to have the matching updates.

trans-unit.source: Download and install a container base image matching the OS version and patch level of the container host.
trans-unit.target: Download and install a container base image matching the OS version and patch level of the container host.

trans-unit.source: In our testing, commands occasionally need to be run multiple times.
trans-unit.target: In our testing, commands occasionally need to be run multiple times.

trans-unit.source: The same principle applies to other actions.
trans-unit.target: The same principle applies to other actions.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you create a new file and it doesn't appear, try touching the file.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you create a new file and it doesn't appear, try touching the file.

trans-unit.source: If you have to do this, let us know via <link><linkText>the forums</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you have to do this, let us know via <link><linkText>the forums</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Build scripts such that they try commands multiple times.
trans-unit.target: Build scripts such that they try commands multiple times.

trans-unit.source: If a command fails, try again.
trans-unit.target: If a command fails, try again.

trans-unit.source: All non-C:/ drives are automatically mapped into new containers
trans-unit.target: All non-C:/ drives are automatically mapped into new containers

trans-unit.source: All non-C:/ drives available to the container host are automatically mapped into new running Windows Server Containers.
trans-unit.target: All non-C:/ drives available to the container host are automatically mapped into new running Windows Server Containers.

trans-unit.source: At this point in time there is no way to selectively map folders into a container, as an interim work around drives are mapped automatically.
trans-unit.target: At this point in time there is no way to selectively map folders into a container, as an interim work around drives are mapped automatically.

trans-unit.source: In the future there will be folder sharing.
trans-unit.target: In the future there will be folder sharing.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Containers are starting very slowly
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Containers are starting very slowly

trans-unit.source: If your container is taking more than 30 seconds to start, it may be performing many duplicate virus scans.
trans-unit.target: If your container is taking more than 30 seconds to start, it may be performing many duplicate virus scans.

trans-unit.source: Many anti-malware solutions, such as Windows Defender, maybe unnecessarily scanning files with-in container images including all of the OS binaries and files in the container OS image.
trans-unit.target: Many anti-malware solutions, such as Windows Defender, maybe unnecessarily scanning files with-in container images including all of the OS binaries and files in the container OS image.

trans-unit.source: This occurs when ever a new container is created and from the anti-malware’s perspective all of the “container’s files” look like new files that have not previously been scanned.
trans-unit.target: This occurs when ever a new container is created and from the anti-malware’s perspective all of the “container’s files” look like new files that have not previously been scanned.

trans-unit.source: So when processes inside the container attempt to read these files the anti-malware components first scan them before allowing access to the files.
trans-unit.target: So when processes inside the container attempt to read these files the anti-malware components first scan them before allowing access to the files.

trans-unit.source: In reality these files were already scanned when the container image was imported or pulled to the server.
trans-unit.target: In reality these files were already scanned when the container image was imported or pulled to the server.

trans-unit.source: In future previews new infrastructure will be in place such that anti-malware solutions, including Windows Defender, will be aware of these situations and can act accordingly to avoid multiple scans.
trans-unit.target: In future previews new infrastructure will be in place such that anti-malware solutions, including Windows Defender, will be aware of these situations and can act accordingly to avoid multiple scans.

trans-unit.source: Number of network compartments per container
trans-unit.target: Number of network compartments per container

trans-unit.source: In this release we support one network compartment per container.
trans-unit.target: In this release we support one network compartment per container.

trans-unit.source: This means that if you have a container with multiple network adapters, you cannot access the same network port on each adapter (e.g. 192.168.0.1:80 and 192.168.0.2:80 belonging to the same container).
trans-unit.target: This means that if you have a container with multiple network adapters, you cannot access the same network port on each adapter (e.g. 192.168.0.1:80 and 192.168.0.2:80 belonging to the same container).

trans-unit.source: If multiple endpoints need to be exposed by a container, use NAT port mapping.
trans-unit.target: If multiple endpoints need to be exposed by a container, use NAT port mapping.

trans-unit.source: Windows containers are not getting IPs
trans-unit.target: Windows containers are not getting IPs

trans-unit.source: If you're connecting to the windows server containers with DHCP VM Switches it's possible for the container host to recieve an IP wwhile the containers do not.
trans-unit.target: If you're connecting to the windows server containers with DHCP VM Switches it's possible for the container host to recieve an IP wwhile the containers do not.

trans-unit.source: The containers get a 169.254.*.* APIPA IP address.
trans-unit.target: The containers get a 169.254.*.* APIPA IP address.

trans-unit.source: This is a side effect of sharing the kernel.
trans-unit.target: This is a side effect of sharing the kernel.

trans-unit.source: All containers affectively have the same mac address.
trans-unit.target: All containers affectively have the same mac address.

trans-unit.source: Enable MAC address spoofing on the container host.
trans-unit.target: Enable MAC address spoofing on the container host.

trans-unit.source: This can be achieved using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: This can be achieved using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Creating file shares does not work in a Container
trans-unit.target: Creating file shares does not work in a Container

trans-unit.source: Currently it is not possible to create a file share within a Container.
trans-unit.target: Currently it is not possible to create a file share within a Container.

trans-unit.source: If you run net share you will see an error like this:
trans-unit.target: If you run net share you will see an error like this:

trans-unit.source: If you want to copy files into a Container you can use the other way round by running net use within the Container.
trans-unit.target: If you want to copy files into a Container you can use the other way round by running net use within the Container.

trans-unit.source: There are so mnay questions about which applications work and don't work in Windows Server Containers, we decided to break application compatability information into <link><linkText>its own article</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: There are so mnay questions about which applications work and don't work in Windows Server Containers, we decided to break application compatability information into <link><linkText>its own article</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Some of the most common issues are located here as well.
trans-unit.target: Some of the most common issues are located here as well.

trans-unit.source: WinRM won't start in a Windows Server Container
trans-unit.target: WinRM won't start in a Windows Server Container

trans-unit.source: WinRM starts, throws an error, and stops again.
trans-unit.target: WinRM starts, throws an error, and stops again.

trans-unit.source: Errors are not logged in the event log.
trans-unit.target: Errors are not logged in the event log.

trans-unit.source: Can't install ASP.NET 4.5 or ASP.NET 3.5 with IIS in a container using DISM
trans-unit.target: Can't install ASP.NET 4.5 or ASP.NET 3.5 with IIS in a container using DISM

trans-unit.source: Installing IIS-ASPNET45 in a container doesn't work inside a Windows Server container.
trans-unit.target: Installing IIS-ASPNET45 in a container doesn't work inside a Windows Server container.

trans-unit.source: This fails because ASP.NET 4.5 doesn't run in a container.
trans-unit.target: This fails because ASP.NET 4.5 doesn't run in a container.

trans-unit.source: Instead, install the Web-Server role to use IIS.
trans-unit.target: Instead, install the Web-Server role to use IIS.

trans-unit.source: See the <link><linkText>application compatability article</linkText><title></title></link> for more information about what applications can be containerized.
trans-unit.target: See the <link><linkText>application compatability article</linkText><title></title></link> for more information about what applications can be containerized.

trans-unit.source: In this pre-release, docker communication is public if you know where to look.
trans-unit.target: In this pre-release, docker communication is public if you know where to look.

trans-unit.source: Docker commands that don't work with Windows Server Containers
trans-unit.target: Docker commands that don't work with Windows Server Containers

trans-unit.source: Docker stops running container and doesn’t show correct error message
trans-unit.target: Docker stops running container and doesn’t show correct error message

trans-unit.source: For running containers: We're working on it :)
trans-unit.target: For running containers: We're working on it :)

trans-unit.source: Error: The windows graphdriver does not support Changes()
trans-unit.target: Error: The windows graphdriver does not support Changes()

trans-unit.source: Error: Invalid signal: KILL Error: failed to kill containers:[]
trans-unit.target: Error: Invalid signal: KILL Error: failed to kill containers:[]

trans-unit.source: No error but the image isn't loading either
trans-unit.target: No error but the image isn't loading either

trans-unit.source: Error: Windows container cannot be paused.
trans-unit.target: Error: Windows container cannot be paused.

trans-unit.source: No port is getting listed even we are able to RDP.
trans-unit.target: No port is getting listed even we are able to RDP.

trans-unit.source: Error: System cannot find the file path.
trans-unit.target: Error: System cannot find the file path.

trans-unit.source: We cant run container using this image.
trans-unit.target: We cant run container using this image.

trans-unit.source: Image is getting added can't be used.
trans-unit.target: Image is getting added can't be used.

trans-unit.source: Error: A system shutdown is in progress.
trans-unit.target: Error: A system shutdown is in progress.

trans-unit.source: Can't test because pause doesn't work yet.
trans-unit.target: Can't test because pause doesn't work yet.

trans-unit.source: If anything that isn't on this list fails (or if a command fails differently than expected), let us know via <link><linkText>the forums</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If anything that isn't on this list fails (or if a command fails differently than expected), let us know via <link><linkText>the forums</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Docker commands that partially work with Windows Server Containers
trans-unit.target: Docker commands that partially work with Windows Server Containers

trans-unit.source: The command doesn't exit when Ctrl-P and CTRL-Q is pressed
trans-unit.target: The command doesn't exit when Ctrl-P and CTRL-Q is pressed

trans-unit.source: Error: Unable to prepare context: Unable to get synlinks
trans-unit.target: Error: Unable to prepare context: Unable to get synlinks

trans-unit.source: Getting occasional "repository does not exit" errors.
trans-unit.target: Getting occasional "repository does not exit" errors.

trans-unit.source: Error: A system shutdown is in progress.
trans-unit.target: Error: A system shutdown is in progress.

trans-unit.source: If anything that isn't on this list fails, if a command fails differently than expected, or if you find a work around, let us know via <link><linkText>the forums</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If anything that isn't on this list fails, if a command fails differently than expected, or if you find a work around, let us know via <link><linkText>the forums</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Pasting commands to interactive Docker session is limited to 50 characters
trans-unit.target: Pasting commands to interactive Docker session is limited to 50 characters

trans-unit.source: If you copy a command line into an interactive Docker session, it is currently limited to 50 characters.
trans-unit.target: If you copy a command line into an interactive Docker session, it is currently limited to 50 characters.

trans-unit.source: The pasted string is simply truncated.
trans-unit.target: The pasted string is simply truncated.

trans-unit.source: This is not by design, we're working on lifting the restriction.
trans-unit.target: This is not by design, we're working on lifting the restriction.

trans-unit.source: net use returns System error 1223 instead of prompting for username or password
trans-unit.target: net use returns System error 1223 instead of prompting for username or password

trans-unit.source: Workaround: specify both, the username and password, when running net use.
trans-unit.target: Workaround: specify both, the username and password, when running net use.

trans-unit.source: HCS Shim errors when creating new container images
trans-unit.target: HCS Shim errors when creating new container images

trans-unit.source: If you encounter error messages like this:
trans-unit.target: If you encounter error messages like this:

trans-unit.source: You're hitting an issue addressed by the Zero Day Patch for Windows Server 2016 TP3.
trans-unit.target: You're hitting an issue addressed by the Zero Day Patch for Windows Server 2016 TP3.

trans-unit.source: This error can also occur when running the Python-3.4.3.msi installer or node-v0.12.7.msi in a container.
trans-unit.target: This error can also occur when running the Python-3.4.3.msi installer or node-v0.12.7.msi in a container.

trans-unit.source: If you hit other hcsshim errors, let us know via <link><linkText>the forums</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you hit other hcsshim errors, let us know via <link><linkText>the forums</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Accessing windows server container with Remote Desktop
trans-unit.target: Accessing windows server container with Remote Desktop

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Containers can be managed/interacted with through a RDP session.
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Containers can be managed/interacted with through a RDP session.

trans-unit.source: The following steps are needed to remotely connect to a Windows Server Container using RDP.
trans-unit.target: The following steps are needed to remotely connect to a Windows Server Container using RDP.

trans-unit.source: It is assumed that the Container is connected to the network via a NAT switch.
trans-unit.target: It is assumed that the Container is connected to the network via a NAT switch.

trans-unit.source: This is the default when setting up a Container host through the installation script or creating a new VM in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This is the default when setting up a Container host through the installation script or creating a new VM in Azure.

trans-unit.source: * In the Container you want to connect to *
trans-unit.target: * In the Container you want to connect to *

trans-unit.source: The following steps require either managing the Container using Docker or, when using PowerShell, specifying the -RunAsAdministrator switch when connecting to the Container.
trans-unit.target: The following steps require either managing the Container using Docker or, when using PowerShell, specifying the -RunAsAdministrator switch when connecting to the Container.

trans-unit.source: Please take the following steps in the Container you want to connect to.
trans-unit.target: Please take the following steps in the Container you want to connect to.

trans-unit.source: New-NetFirewallRule -Name "ContainerRDP" -DisplayName "RDP Port for connecting to Container" -Protocol TCP -LocalPort @(3390) -Action Allow
trans-unit.target: New-NetFirewallRule -Name "ContainerRDP" -DisplayName "RDP Port for connecting to Container" -Protocol TCP -LocalPort @(3390) -Action Allow

trans-unit.source: Please specify administrator as the user name and the password that you chose as the password.
trans-unit.target: Please specify administrator as the user name and the password that you chose as the password.

trans-unit.source: The Remote Desktop Connection will ask you whether you want connect to the system despite certificate errors.
trans-unit.target: The Remote Desktop Connection will ask you whether you want connect to the system despite certificate errors.

trans-unit.source: If you select "Yes", the RDP connection will be opened.
trans-unit.target: If you select "Yes", the RDP connection will be opened.

trans-unit.source: Note: Exiting the container RDP session without logoff may prevent the container from shutting down.
trans-unit.target: Note: Exiting the container RDP session without logoff may prevent the container from shutting down.

trans-unit.source: Please make sure to exit the RDP session by typing "logoff" (instead of "exit" or just closing the RDP window) before shutting the container down.
trans-unit.target: Please make sure to exit the RDP session by typing "logoff" (instead of "exit" or just closing the RDP window) before shutting the container down.

trans-unit.source: Enter-PSSession has containerid argument, New-PSSession doesn't
trans-unit.target: Enter-PSSession has containerid argument, New-PSSession doesn't

trans-unit.source: We're planning on full cimsession support in the future.
trans-unit.target: We're planning on full cimsession support in the future.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to voice feature requests in <link><linkText>the forums</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to voice feature requests in <link><linkText>the forums</linkText><title></title></link>.
